intro: Racosperma murrayanum, commonly known as the Murray's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves with multiple leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale green, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces elongated, woody pods containing seeds. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
